frame.name: Activity_stop
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> ceases an <fen>Activity</fen> without completing it. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Time">After the lawsuit</fex>, <fex name="Agent">the company</fex> <t>stopped</t> <fex name="Activity">producing the once very profitable toy</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Agent">The rugby club</fex> <t>terminated</t> <fex name="Activity">negotiations with Argyll</fex> <fex name="Time">in September 1988</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> stopped the <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> stops the <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> stops the <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for a <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Agent</fen> stops the <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of the stopped <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Activity
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> stops.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the length of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Activity</fen> is stopped.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Agent</fen> stops the <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Co-timed_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the last <fen>Co-timed_event</fen> of the stopped <fen>Activity</fen>. <ex><fex name="Co-timed_event">With the arrival of the bishop</fex>, everyone <t>stopped</t> working.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the completeness of stopping. </def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. It is to be distinguished from Iteration, which pertains simply to the number of times an event occurs-Iteration expressions answer the question how many times. </def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies an event during which the <fen>Agent</fen> stops the <fen>Activity</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Re-encoding
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. </def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. </def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: stop.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: discontinue an action, practice, or habit.

lexUnit.name: halt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: bring or come to an abrupt stop

lexUnit.name: discontinue.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stop doing, providing, or making.

lexUnit.name: cease.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: come or bring to an end; stop.

lexUnit.name: abandon.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give up (an action or practice) completely. [FN: this is distinct from abandoning a belief]
